business_definition: Credit or debit card number used for the authorization transaction - primary key component
Timestamp when the authorization request was processed - primary key component
Type of authorization transaction being processed (e.g. purchase, refund, pre-auth)
Expiration date of the card in MMYY format used to validate card validity
Type of message in the authorization protocol (e.g. request, response, reversal)
Source system or channel that originated the authorization message
Unique authorization identification code assigned to the transaction
Response code indicating approval or decline status of the authorization
Detailed reason code explaining the authorization response decision
ISO 8583 processing code defining the transaction type and account types involved
Original transaction amount requested for authorization in currency units
Actual amount approved for the transaction which may differ from requested amount
Merchant Category Code (MCC) classifying the type of merchant business
Three-character country code of the acquiring institution processing the transaction
Point of sale entry mode indicating how card data was captured (chip, swipe, manual)
Unique identifier assigned to the merchant location processing the transaction
Business name of the merchant where the transaction occurred
City location of the merchant establishment
Two-character state or province code of the merchant location
Postal or ZIP code of the merchant location
Unique identifier for the specific transaction in the authorization system
Status indicator showing if transaction matched fraud detection rules or patterns
Flag indicating whether the authorization was identified as fraudulent (Y/N)
Date when fraud was reported or detected for this authorization
Account identifier linking the authorization to the cardholder account
Customer identifier linking the authorization to the cardholder customer record
